item.title: Corporate Restructuring
item.description: Corporate restructuring is an action taken by the corporate entity to significantly modify the capital structure or operations and to eliminate all the financial crisis and enhance the companyâ€™s performance. Generally, corporate restructuring happens when a corporate entity experiences significant problems and when it is in financial jeopardy. It can be driven by external factors requiring a change in the organizational structure or business model of an entity, or it can be driven by the necessity to make financial adjustments to its assets and liabilities.
